intro: Taraxacum baicalense, commonly known as the Baikal dandelion, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including the Lake Baikal area. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flower heads consist of numerous small florets, which mature into white, fluffy seeds. The species is noted for its adaptability to harsh environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
